I find playing Yasuo with high ping very difficult, but then again I rarely have ping higher than 30 so I haven't had much experience with ping issues.
While i can agree on Yas being hard to play with higher ping, I'd say Riven is slightly worse. trying to fast q with 250+ ping is literally infuriating

I live in a shared house with 3 other people, 2 of whom dont game and dont understand how annoying ping spiking is. {{champion:17}}  is so reliant on fast reactions to run in and out, firing a dart and then ducking into bushes to lose agro, so depressing when he fires 3 darts before reacting to commands, and its almost impossible to outplay ganks.
then dont play as teemo

Mind you, playing almost any champ with intermittent ping is even more so. Steady ping can be dealt with, and can be adjusted to. But when you get sudden drops from 45 to 315, playing any sort of game is rough. Particularly so on mechanically heavy and/or skillshot orientated champs./

ikr, he just has too many micro mechanics to manage properly when he is lagging, then with him being squishy and having the smallest skill shot in the game (which he relies on for damage) is near impossible to hit lagging(its like 10 units wide compared to next smallest of 25 units).
I like how the cart stops at 200 ping but when most people lag it  goes up to about 500 to 1800 ms not 250 max.
I like how you didn't even read the graph. Its the 'difference' in ping compared to the average in the game, not a min/max ping.

Your comment is redundant as the higher the ping the lower the chance of winning. It's quite obvious unless you're 5. Have you ever looked at a graph before? Chance of winning isn't suddenly going to spike to 98% when you're at 1800 ping.
if everyone on the team had 1800 do you think they will win?

I feel if your lag is Steady, you learn to work with it, i played all last season in the 50 range you get used to it, you learn to cs as an adc main. this season with a pc and network upgrade i am now getting used to to 20 range. My issue is when your happily lanning away and you spike to 500+ for no reason, you stand there still autoing away while secretly spamming your base or tower waiting for the game to let you retreat before the other team notices... sadly your killed and you try and tell your team mates "lag" but now your "feeding" your team rages and the games goes to hell...
50ms is low asf dude

Thanks riot. You made the ping even worse
One does not simply complain about 200 ping, that is fine. What we complain about is 300+ ping. Can we get some charts on that?

If you have a difference of about 30 or 40 ping with a point-and-click champ, then there isn't going to much difference in your performance or outcome of the game. But if you had, say, 3000 ping difference then there's going to be a massive difference regardless of which champs you play. I think the probability of winning a game is more based on the margin of ping difference rather than the champion

its hard to pick a "hardest champion to play with lag" for me since my average ping is around 13-25, then when it spikes it goes well over 700. i cant pick a hardest champion when its borderline impossible to play any of them. but i feel, even the less mechanically intensive ADC's will have their winrate affected by latency due to them being such an important role in a team comp. that is assuming they dont get 1 shot by the likes of champions such as rango or darius, making your latency issues irrelevant.
One time i actually had 6 million ping during a match, i didnt disconnect or anything, there was just like one minute delays. glad it fixed itself a couple minutes later{{item:3151}}

As a science student, and a league player with chronic ping issues, I really appreciate this post!
For me, Draven is probably the most frustrating champion to play with high ping - you can't catch axes, and you can't do any damage! {{champion:119}}

Meanwhile, ADC is the easiest role to play at any other time. Seriously, ADC mains need to stop complaining. You have a lane partner, or should I say 'mother', who is there to baby you through the first 20 mins of game and attempt to keep you alive. And then your jungler, or 'rednecked uncle', comes along to hand you kills on a challenger platter. Half the team revolves around you, and all you do is complain. And we wonder why DoubleLift talks so much trash...
Then why werent the servers put in Adelaide for more equitable distance for ALL australians?
Astonishing discovery! If you lag you're more likely to lose. Who would of guessed!!?
